_header: Take wind water white and green
Note:
For a prose redaction see San Marino, CA, Henry Huntington Library HU 1051, f. 132v. Sometimes follows 4236; sometimes preceded by 482. Singer (1928)
XSinger, Dorothea Waley. Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts. 3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31, 849, 849A.
Title(s): ad mineralia alteranda in terram cristallinam
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 1280 (SC 8216), p. 31: see Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 1450, Part VII (SC 7628) version.
_description: Alchemical verses, ascribed (in 1652) to Pearce the Black Monk, nine lines in English, with occasional Latin words, and four lines of Latin — in couplets

BodAsh1450.First Lines:
Take wynde and water white & greneand drawe therof lac
                        virginis…
BodAsh1450.Last Lines:
…Sublimatio attractio & etiim fixatio&
                        sulphuris nostri sine foliati creatio

BodAsh1487.First Lines:
Take wynde and water white and greeneand therof drawe a Lac
                        virgine…
BodAsh1487.Last Lines:
…Sublimatio attractio et etiam
                        fixatioet sulphuris nostri siue foliati creatio

BodAsh1492.First Lines:
Take winde water white & greeneAnd drawe therof a Lac
                        virgine…
BodAsh1492.Last Lines:
…sublimatio et fixatio et sulphuris[nostri] sive foliate
                        creatio

CamTCC1119.First Lines:
Tak wind and water whit and greenAnd draw thereof Lac
                        Viregine…
CamTCC1119.Last Lines:
…sublimatio Attractio & etiam fixa-tio & sulphuris
                        nostri sine foliatio

BLSl1092.First Lines:
Take winde water white & greeneAnd draw therof lac
                        virginis…
BLSl1092.Last Lines:
…sublimatio attractio & etiam fixatioEt Sulphuris
                        nostri siue foliati creatio

BLSl1098.First Lines:
Take wynde water white & greene& drawe thereof lac
                        virginis…
BLSl1098.Last Lines:
…dissolutio et congelatio sublimatio, attractioet etiam
                        fixatio et sulphuris nostri foliati creatio
BLSl1098.Note: Eight lines of English and four of Latin; preceded by 5095 and 4236.

BLSl1842.First Lines:
Take winde water white & greeneand drawe thereof a lac
                        virginis…
BLSl1842.Last Lines:
…nostra dissolutio et congelatio sublimatio attractioet
                        etiam fixatio et sulphuris nostri siue foliati creatio

BLSl3580B.First Lines:
Take wynde water white & grene& drawe therof a Lac
                        virgyne…
BLSl3580B.Last Lines:
…so mayntayninge still your fiertill all be come þat you
                    desire
BLSl3580B.Note:
Variant of ten lines English; see also a prose version on f.
                    185.

BLSl3667.First Lines:
Take wynde water whit & gryne& drawe thar of a lak
                        vergene…
BLSl3667.Last Lines:
…cintynewe & a lyttill encrise your firetyll he be red
                    & full of yere
BLSl3667.Note: Abbreviated version of 8 lines English only, preceded by 5095 and 4236.

BLSl3747.First Lines:
Take wynde water white and greneAnd drawe therof a lac
                        virgene…
BLSl3747.Last Lines:
…soblimato altato & intiam fixato& sulphuris nostri
                        sine tere foliate [creaco]
BLSl3747.Editions:
Ashmole,  Elias. 
             Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum.
         London: J. Grimond, 1652: 431.

YaleBeiOsfa16.First Lines:
Tak wynd watter whit & grenedo them to gether as I
                    meane…
YaleBeiOsfa16.Last Lines:
…the child thus for me at one generationall shall haue &
                    mak them of his awn fassio[n]
YaleBeiOsfa16.Note:
Second occurrence in this MS; page numbered 39; written by a hand of the
                    sixteenth century; ends ‘Explicit’.
